title: Ernest Romens
text:
Ernest Romens (1904 - 1954) was a French racewalker.
Romens won the extreme <a href="racewalking">racewalking</a>, <a href="Paris-Strasbourg">Paris-Strasbourg</a> march in 1933, 1935 and 1937.
At its third victory, he broke the record time 300 km of road. He received dozens of telegrams from the American <a href="Alsatians%20%28people%29">Alsatian</a> community, which followed his progress in the press.
